dependencies.description:
nose extends the test loading and running features of unittest, making
it easier to write, find and run tests.
dependencies.name: py-nose

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.
dependencies.name: py-pytest

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm

dependencies.description:
This is a setuptools_scm plugin that adds support for git archives (for
example the ones GitHub automatically generates).
dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm-git-archive

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description:
DaCe is a fast parallel programming framework that takes code in
Python/NumPy and other programming languages, and maps it to high-
performance CPU, GPU, and FPGA programs, which can be optimized
programmatically or interactively.
dependent_to.name: py-dace

dependent_to.description:
A source-to-source Fortran compiler designed to programmatically
optimise, parallelise and instrument HPC applications (written in
Fortran) via user- provided transformation scripts. Additionally,
PSyclone supports the development of kernel-based, Fortran-embedded DSLs
and is used in the UK Met Office's next-generation modelling system,
LFRic.
dependent_to.name: py-psyclone

description:
This project is based upon the Fortran parser originally developed by
Pearu Peterson for the F2PY project, www.f2py.com. It provides a parser
for Fortran source code (up to and including F2008) implemented purely
in Python with minimal dependencies.
name: py-fparser

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
